titleStmt.title: Extract from property register [208-209 AD]
titleStmt.author: Flavia Ptollarous, daughter of Marcus Flavius Diogenes

msContents.summary: Extract from the property archives of the Arsinoite: Flavia Ptollarous declared that she obtained from her father some land as an "irrevocable gift"

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
16 lines of writing by 2 hands: the first is neat and calligraphic, while the second, which writes in red ink, is cursive and faster
Lines of x's in red and black ink define the document or are used as line fillers
Portions of the papyrus are damaged by insects
The text sheds light on the nature of the "irrevocable gift," in this case a gift of land by a father to his daughter
It is intersting that, although the land belonged to Stratippos, Diogenes' son, it is the father who has the power to donate it to his daugher
